required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Follow-up to Evaluate the Clinical Usefulness of Gentamicin-coated Titanium Nails in Tibia Fractures
clinical_study.official_title: Prospective Open Label Post Market Clinical Follow-up to Evaluate the Clinical Usefulness of the Operative Stabilization of Closed and Open Fractures of the Tibia Using Gentamicin - Coated Titanium Nails

brief_summary.textblock: This post market clinical follow-up is to confirm the clinical usefulness of the Expert Tibial Nail (ETN) PROtect device for operative stabilization in patients with a tibia fracture as measured by the quality of life (EQ5D, SF-12) instruments, disease-specific questionnaires (Iowa Ankle Score, WOMAC) and assessment of (Non-)Device Related Adverse Events or complications.

primary_outcome.measure: Quality of Life: SF-12 Physical Component Summary (PCS)
primary_outcome.description: The Short Form (SF)-12 health survey comprises 12 questions related to health and wellbeing over the prior four weeks. The responses to these 12 questions are entered into a standardized algorithm to provide summaries of physical and mental health (i.e., physical composite score [PCS] and mental composite score [MCS]). The summary scores are standardized and normalized such that a score of 50 for either the PCS or MCS corresponds to that of an average, healthy person. A score lower than 50 indicates poorer physical and mental health compared to an average, healthy person. It was administered at 3, 6, 12 and 18 months post-operatively.

primary_outcome.measure: Quality of Life: SF-12 Mental Component Summary (MCS)
primary_outcome.description: The SF-12 short form health survey comprises 12 questions related to health and wellbeing over the prior four weeks. The responses to these 12 questions are entered into a standardized algorithm to provide summaries of physical and mental health (i.e., physical composite score [PCS] and mental composite score [MCS]). The summary scores are standardized and normalized such that a score of 50 for either the PCS or MCS corresponds to that of an average, healthy person. A score lower than 50 indicates poorer physical and mental health compared to an average, healthy person. It was administered at 3, 6, 12 and 18 months post-operatively.

The Euroqol Health Survey (EQ-5D, 3-level) was completed on five dimensions (mobility, self care, usual activities, pain/discomfort and anxiety/depression) to measure health-related quality of life on a scale from 0-1. A higher score indicates better quality of life.

The Iowa Ankle Score was administered at baseline (retrospective assessment of pre-trauma condition) as well as at 3, 6, 12 and 18 months post-operatively to measures ankle function across four dimensions (function, freedom from pain, gait, range of motion) on a scale of 0-100, where 100 is assigned to full function.

The Western Ontario and McMaster Universities Arthritis Index (WOMAC) questionnaire was administered at 3, 6, 12 and 18 months post-operatively to assess three dimensions: pain, disability and joint stiffness in the knee. Each question is scored on a scale of 0-4, which correspond to: None (0), Mild (1), Moderate (2), Severe (3), and Extreme (4). The scores are summed up, with a possible score range of 0-96. A higher score on the WOMAC indicate more functional limitations.

Infections at the site of ETN PROtect implantation were classified according to Center for Disease Control (CDC) definition into: superficial incisional surgical site infection (SSI), affecting skin and subcutaneous tissue deep incisional SSI, affecting deep soft tissue organ/ space SSI (Osteomyelitis), affecting joint or bursa

secondary_outcome.measure: Evidence of Anatomic Bone Union According to Johnson Classification
secondary_outcome.description: Anatomic bone union was assessed according to Johnson et al.*: A0: pseudoarthrosis; A1: unilateral pseudoarthrosis; A2: insufficient unilateral bone mass; A3: contiguous union without hypertrophy; A4: solid union of the fracture site. *Johnson EE, Urist MR, Finerman GA. Repair of segmental defects of the tibia with cancellous bone grafts augmented with human bone morphogenetic protein. A preliminary report. Clin.Orthop.Relat Res. 1988;249-57

secondary_outcome.measure: Evidence of Economic Bone Union According to Johnson Classification
secondary_outcome.description: Economic bone union was assessed according to Johnson et al.*: E0: complete invalid; E1: no gainful employment; E2: able to work but did not return to previous occupation; E3: returned to previous occupation on a part-time or limited status; E4: returned to previous occupation without restrictions. *Johnson EE, Urist MR, Finerman GA. Repair of segmental defects of the tibia with cancellous bone grafts augmented with human bone morphogenetic protein. A preliminary report. Clin.Orthop.Relat Res. 1988;249-57

secondary_outcome.measure: Evidence of Functional Bone Union According to Johnson Classification
secondary_outcome.description: Functional bone union was assessed according to Johnson et al.*: F0: motion at the fracture site; F1: level of pain is the same as before operation but able to perform all daily tasks of living; F2: occasional extremity pain and able to perform activities of daily living; F3: no pain and able to perform all activities except sports; F4: complete recovery, no recurrent episodes of pain, and unrestricted activity. *Johnson EE, Urist MR, Finerman GA. Repair of segmental defects of the tibia with cancellous bone grafts augmented with human bone morphogenetic protein. A preliminary report. Clin.Orthop.Relat Res. 1988;249-57
Surgeons' perceived satisfaction was assessed on a scale from 0 to 100 (0 = very satisfied, 100 = disappointed).

secondary_outcome.measure: Likelihood to Develop Wound Infection Assessed by Surgeon
secondary_outcome.description: The likelihood to develop a wound infection was assessed by the surgeon on a scale from 0 to 100 (0 = almost nil, 100 = absolutely sure).

secondary_outcome.measure: Likelihood to Develop a Non-union Assessed by Surgeon
secondary_outcome.description: The likelihood to develop a non-union was assessed by the surgeon on a scale from 0 to 100 (0 = almost nil, 100 = absolutely sure).
Leg pain intensity was rated on a 100-mm visual analog scale (VAS). A score of zero indicated no pain at all, and 100 represented the worst possible pain.
Patient's perceived satisfaction was scored on a 100mm visual analog scale (VAS). A score of zero indicated no satisfaction, while a score of 100 indicated completely satisfied.
The time from surgery to full weight bearing was assessed in days.

arm_group.description: There is only 1 cohort in this case series

intervention.description: Expert Tibial Nail PROtect with Gentamicin coating

study_pop.textblock: Patients presenting to the ER with a tibia fracture

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult patients aged 18 years or more
- Open or closed tibia fracture according to the surgical technique
Exclusion Criteria:
- Women who are pregnant or breast-feeding or are planning to become pregnant during the study
- Patients with consumptive/ malignant primary disease and a life expectancy of < 3 months
- Patients with a known allergy to aminoglycosides
- Physical or mental incapacity, which makes it impossible to obtain informed consent
- History of drug and alcohol abuse
- Patient unlikely to cooperate
- Legal incompetence

group.title: ETN PROtect
group.description: ETN PROtect: Expert Tibial Nail PROtect with Gentamicin coating.

baseline.population: The baseline analysis population consistes of patients with an open or closed tibia fracture who were treated with the ETN PROtect.

group.title: ETN PROtect
group.description: There is only 1 cohort in this case series. ETN PROtect: Expert Tibial Nail PROtect with Gentamicin coating

measure.title: Fracture type
measure.description: Patients were divided into two groups of fracture types: (1) traumatic/pathologic fractures and (2) other: patients receiving the ETN PROtect due to revision purposes.

measure.title: Time from injury to surgery for traumatic/pathologic patients
measure.description: The time-to-surgery was recorded for 67 traumatic/pathologic patients.

measure.title: Time from injury to surgery for revision patients
measure.description: The time-to-surgery was recorded for 21 revision-patients.

outcome.title: Quality of Life: SF-12 Physical Component Summary (PCS)
outcome.description: The Short Form (SF)-12 health survey comprises 12 questions related to health and wellbeing over the prior four weeks. The responses to these 12 questions are entered into a standardized algorithm to provide summaries of physical and mental health (i.e., physical composite score [PCS] and mental composite score [MCS]). The summary scores are standardized and normalized such that a score of 50 for either the PCS or MCS corresponds to that of an average, healthy person. A score lower than 50 indicates poorer physical and mental health compared to an average, healthy person. It was administered at 3, 6, 12 and 18 months post-operatively.
outcome.population: Efficacy is based on the number of patients that were treated with the ETN PROtect according to the protocol. Patients were excluded due to a failure to meet the in-/exclusion criteria (2) and a surgical procedure that was not according to the surgical technique (8).

group.title: ETN PROtect
group.description: ETN PROtect: Expert Tibial Nail PROtect with Gentamicin coating.

outcome.title: Evidence of Anatomic Bone Union According to Johnson Classification
outcome.description: Anatomic bone union was assessed according to Johnson et al.*: A0: pseudoarthrosis; A1: unilateral pseudoarthrosis; A2: insufficient unilateral bone mass; A3: contiguous union without hypertrophy; A4: solid union of the fracture site. *Johnson EE, Urist MR, Finerman GA. Repair of segmental defects of the tibia with cancellous bone grafts augmented with human bone morphogenetic protein. A preliminary report. Clin.Orthop.Relat Res. 1988;249-57
outcome.population: Efficacy is based on the number of patients that were treated with the ETN PROtect according to the protocol. Patients were excluded due to a failure to meet the in-/exclusion criteria (2) and a surgical procedure that was not according to the surgical technique (8). For the anatomic bone union at 12 months, data of 78 patients is available.

outcome.title: Likelihood to Develop Wound Infection Assessed by Surgeon
outcome.description: The likelihood to develop a wound infection was assessed by the surgeon on a scale from 0 to 100 (0 = almost nil, 100 = absolutely sure).
outcome.population: Efficacy is based on the number of patients that were treated with the ETN PROtect according to the protocol. Patients were excluded due to a failure to meet the in-/exclusion criteria (2) and a surgical procedure that was not according to the surgical technique (8).

outcome.population: Efficacy is based on the number of patients that were treated with the ETN PROtect according to the protocol. Patients were excluded due to a failure to meet the in-/exclusion criteria (2) and a surgical procedure that was not according to the surgical technique (8). Patient satisfaction was completed by 84 patients.

group.description: ETN PROtect: Expert Tibial Nail PROtect with Gentamicin coating.

measure.title: Patient's Perceived Satisfaction
measure.description: Patient's perceived satisfaction was scored on a 100mm visual analog scale (VAS). A score of zero indicated no satisfaction, while a score of 100 indicated completely satisfied.
measure.population: Efficacy is based on the number of patients that were treated with the ETN PROtect according to the protocol. Patients were excluded due to a failure to meet the in-/exclusion criteria (2) and a surgical procedure that was not according to the surgical technique (8). Patient satisfaction was completed by 84 patients.

outcome.title: Time to Full Weight Bearing
outcome.description: The time from surgery to full weight bearing was assessed in days.
outcome.population: Efficacy is based on the number of patients that were treated with the ETN PROtect according to the protocol. Patients were excluded due to a failure to meet the in-/exclusion criteria (2) and a surgical procedure that was not according to the surgical technique (8). 3 patients never reached full weight bearing, and 1 dropped out before 6 weeks.

group.title: ETN PROtect
group.description: ETN PROtect: Expert Tibial Nail PROtect with Gentamicin coating.

measure.title: Time to Full Weight Bearing
measure.description: The time from surgery to full weight bearing was assessed in days.
measure.population: Efficacy is based on the number of patients that were treated with the ETN PROtect according to the protocol. Patients were excluded due to a failure to meet the in-/exclusion criteria (2) and a surgical procedure that was not according to the surgical technique (8). 3 patients never reached full weight bearing, and 1 dropped out before 6 weeks.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events were recorded from treatment (implantation of the device) through the end of the follow-up period at 18 months.

group.title: ETN PROtect
group.description: ETN PROtect: Expert Tibial Nail PROtect with Gentamicin coating.

event.sub_title: LOSS OF RANGE OF MOTION ASSOCIATED WITH DEVICE
DISORDERS OF MUSCLE, LIGAMENT, AND FASCIA

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: A single comprehensive publication may be authored on the procedure and outcomes of the trial. Sites that enroll less than five patients will not be included in the publication. Synthes GmbH will have the right to review prior to submission. Each clinical site that enrolls ten patients will have the option to submit an abstract for publication or presentation at a regional, national, or international conference on their work. Synthes GmbH will have the right to review prior to submission.
